EC63DDE820C4466B842387B3FF967E67.description: Evaluate group process: Establish and use criteria to evaluate group process and personal contributions; set goals and make plans for improvement

272A73E418AC42FC8A1F3C98B03668C7.description: Share responsibility for the completion of team projects by establishing clear purpose and procedures for solving problems, monitoring progress and making modifications to meet stated objectives

9C88A408DD4F445CAF4BDD467C413B7E.description: Generate and access ideas in a group, and use a variety of methods to focus and clarify topics for research or investigations

9558D69FC7C84760BFEC15BA6348BEE1.description: Discuss and choose ways to coordinate the abilities and interests of individual group members to achieve group goals

4989DF869CA049429A2AE143AE6D02F7.description: Contribute to group efforts to reach consensus or conclusions, by engaging in dialogue to understand the ideas and viewpoints of others

985BA703C72C4CD8B4FEB8A475E22BC0.description: Use language to show respect: Create or use oral, print and other media texts in ways that are respectful of people, opinions, communities and cultures

1731723D6E9C40919E4B228AED448AA4.description: Celebrate accomplishments and events: Explore and experiment with various ways in which language arts are used across cultures, age groups and genders to honour and celebrate people and events

8BA0EEF7F7564DA795763B658D9A72CB.description: Relate texts to culture: Analyze how oral, print and other media texts reflect the traditions, beliefs and technologies of different cultures, communities or periods in history

B3DD99904036429F9B3216765E09D942.description: Take responsibility for developing and sharing oral, print and other media texts and for responding respectfully to the texts of others

EF21369F9F1C4FBFB8D169DD692390BE.description: Examine how personal experiences, cultural traditions and Canadian perspectives are presented in oral, print and other media texts

1281FD707AB740AF978FB2D5014689E8.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to respect, support and collaborate with others.

E37FCC2616F841D59613959A900F54AA.description: Provide feedback that encourages the presenter and audience to consider other ideas and additional information

D675357EF77147409A5A732F7B60A2C6.description: Follow the train of thought, and evaluate the credibility of the presenter and the evidence provided

68C842DCBDFB459CB86FE0ED414E0054.description: Use effective oral and visual communication: Integrate a variety of media and display techniques, as appropriate, to enhance the appeal, accuracy and persuasiveness of presentations

6620BC0B13844778A33E3D7CB719F38A.description: Enhance presentation: Choose appropriate types of evidence and strategies to clarify ideas and information, and to convince various readers and audiences

A42043A4B40F40979E76C537B834BDFC.description: Present information:  Select, organize and present information to appeal to the interests and background knowledge of various readers or audiences

B74FC3346ABB409DB0E511CFE7282D3E.description: Know that rules for punctuation can vary, and adjust punctuation use for effect in own writing

C19B7C8293ED460EA3DC7BE090210A5E.description: Use dashes to show sentence breaks or interrupted speech, where appropriate in own writing

FE6DA3EDA83D4C1DB43CD315368DB77C.description: Use quotation marks to distinguish words being discussed in own writing

ECE12C4EF8BE4106A181C996D8F1A4F2.description: Identify and use variant spellings for particular effects, depending on audience, purpose, content and context

00542C73FDAF4831ABFF827EDB8D7F1A.description: Identify situations in which careful attention to correct spelling is especially important

A44482BE02F446DEA96D2F0A16A7D553.description: Demonstrate the deliberate, conscientious and independent application of a variety of editing and proofreading strategies to confirm spellings in own writing

941111E1DC86419584381F3F18C50952.description: Use a variety of strategies to make effective transitions between sentences and paragraphs in own writing

78AAA476785340299367F195541D59D8.description: Identify and use coordination, subordination and apposition to enhance communication

80ADDFF91C114AF988796F5171D70E76.description: Identify and use parallel structure in own writing

BAD2F7309FAE4A4D96F9A88537AAA7A0.description: Enhance artistry: Experiment with the language and components of particular forms to communicate themes or represent the perspectives of a variety of people or characters

C2FB2FCB08564A4695428834173F5AB8.description: Explore the derivation and use of words, phrases and jargon, including variations in language, accent and dialect in Canadian communities and regions

B6C8F8FB5FB84044B0818901136CEAE5.description: Distinguish between the denotative and connotative meaning of words, and discuss effectiveness for achieving purpose and affecting audience

8A38DD35FC9B41F0A93FF6B6BAD63F4D.description: Identify and experiment with some principles of design that enhance the presentation of texts

422324EC24D04328B6E67C040408417B.description: Develop personal handwriting styles appropriate for a variety of purposes

FC6DB6BAB51B4544864343C8EC67220B.description: revise to combine narration, description and exposition effectively

2054C466ADCE46AAA82369E181C4DD0B.description: Revise to enhance effective transitions between ideas and maintain a consistent organizational pattern

B98E9EB1466D4F5F8D1246850364F5CC.description: Revise to ensure effective introductions, consistent points of view, effective transitions between ideas and appropriate conclusions

32968147BE704C7E88F4DB94C92C5FA3.description: Work collaboratively to make appropriate revisions based on feedback provided by peers

2DB5F02FCEC049D484BB16AD3CEA02B1.description: Share sample treatments of a topic with peers, and ask for feedback on the relative effectiveness of each

562AA019252C40DBB572B348A7FFD9B0.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to enhance the clarity and artistry of communication.

9BC6D3C28E8A4459A88DCA280561F6C3.description: Review research process: Reflect on the research process, identifying areas of strength and ways to improve further research activities

6A125D6DC8914AC0B0055B292EC50B74.description: Integrate appropriate visual, print and/or other media to reinforce overall impression or point of view and engage the audience

303F2323EB1E41EBAC009DE3CA3FD74D.description: Communicate ideas and information in a variety of oral, print and other media texts, such as media scripts, multimedia presentations, panel discussions and articles

956D568DECF74942BA1A45DCF4FFDC63.description: Reflect on new understanding and its value to self and others

23218C46C0C64179A1E2248156B0558C.description: Evaluate usefulness, relevance and completeness of gathered information; address information gaps

A2DD20E2B4A14CE48E1403274388B721.description: Choose specific vocabulary, and use conventions accurately and effectively to enhance credibility

5685F3D59D144A8DB71D6751FCE162E0.description: Select and record ideas and information that will support an opinion or point of view, appeal to the audience, and suit the tone and length of the chosen form of oral, print or other media text

12FFB6FE5C21426992809E3C983ABA87.description: Use own words to summarize and record information in a variety of forms; paraphrase and/or quote relevant facts and opinions; reference sources

FADAB1D0B46341BDADB99C81B559C0B2.description: Develop coherence by relating all key ideas to the overall purpose of the oral, print or other media text

7E96934639564FB4828C278A8FBB6854.description: Balance all sections of oral, print and other media texts and ensure sentences, paragraphs and key ideas are linked throughout

CB0FD7023E54431EAD4CD2CB746598C8.description: Organize ideas and information by developing and selecting appropriate categories and organizational structures

7C641E13F3044EE5BB16DF4B9963ED81.description: Evaluate sources: Evaluate sources for currency, reliability and possible bias of information for a particular research project

521F593ADDE04464AA3989F67438D7A8.description: Follow up on cited references to locate additional information

72EF4611D7BD48B194C2A4A605AAFD92.description: Distinguish between primary and secondary sources, and determine the usefulness of each for research purposes

4E23349C6FAE447D895329054B7BA3BC.description: Expand and use a variety of tools and text features, such as organizational patterns of texts, page layouts, font styles and sizes, colour and voice-overs, to access information

B0A551EDF81140CFB5A8A41575A98C05.description: Use a variety of sources: Obtain information reflecting multiple perspectives from a variety of sources, such as expository essays, graphs, diagrams, online catalogues, periodical indices, film libraries, electronic databases and the Internet, when conducting research

C41ABEE14F2446E38DDC9980604F04D8.description: Plan to gather information: Select information sources that will provide effective support, convincing argument or unique perspectives

83A51E2B147F4E6DB3C0E458ACD04C69.description: Determine information needs: Select types and sources of information to achieve an effective balance between researched information and own ideas

5F1EAD595880489BB9F9A8671E9C0978.description: Assess adequacy, accuracy, detail and appropriateness of oral, print and other media texts to support or further develop arguments, opinions or points of view

496C224E25114F148A964F6B0BA06FC2.description: Synthesize ideas and information from a variety of sources to develop own opinions, points of view and general impressions

D7EDBA21F6624FB5ABD7C1D5C9AD8DF1.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to manage ideas and information.

A9FF4DE66E034754B94DB4518440C371.description: Create oral, print and other media texts that include main and minor characters, and show how the main character develops and changes as a result of the action and events

C7BF398CCA5A4AB5BAAC42E0DCF4BC47.description: Create oral, print and other media texts that interrelate plot, setting and character, and reveal the significance of the action

19424360E1234C968DF8CE8C77B85B43.description: Elaborate on the expression of ideas: Create oral, print and other media texts on common literary themes

B1B21BAC4F844B5DA96DC9F4AEADD198.description: Generate ideas: Generalize from own experience to create oral, print and other media texts on a theme

AC50006493084FCF9AA7D353872BC409.description: Experiment with language: Analyze creative uses of language and visuals in popular culture, such as advertisements, electronic magazines and the Internet; recognize how imagery and figurative language, such as metaphor, create a dominant impression, mood and tone

FC52389D6F434A84AE8D732234B541AE.description: Summarize the content of media texts, and suggest alternative treatments

7A12614D42374F0DA100712FFD62D920.description: Identify ways that a change in narrator might affect the overall meaning of oral, print and other media texts

7F013C191B024EC889CCBC5FC542593D.description: Compare a main character in one text to the main character in another text from a different era, genre or medium

B334364FC78A453EBE111E64CE3EF822.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of oral, print and other media texts, considering the believability of plot and setting, the credibility of characters, and the development and resolution of conflict

29767DF1F8A04F189FCE790CFAFAA26B.description: Compare the development of character, plot and theme in two oral, print or other media texts

3A44AFD406C24508AD16F8BBB285DEB9.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of different types of media texts for presenting ideas and information

4CB8C143EEB24368835D68BDFF20EB4D.description: Explain the relationships between purposes and characteristics of various forms and genres of oral, print and other media texts

9BD1F9E3E5B04487BA393394A63BBA4D.description: Identify features that define particular oral, print and other media texts; discuss differences in style and their effects on content and audience impression

C8100AA268A44702880E797FC9FC1615.description: Describe how theme, dominant impression and mood are developed and sustained through choices in language use and the interrelationship of plot, setting and character

185A7D55B91B4311B421BA5B0A04B2A7.description: Discuss character development in terms of consistency of behaviour and plausibility of change

75FAE988F7584E89A096008BFC592182.description: Discuss how techniques, such as irony, symbolism, perspective and proportion, communicate meaning and enhance effect in oral, print and other media texts

C1AF54F59E5C4167939051573FF3054A.description: Relate the themes, emotions and experiences portrayed in oral, print and other media texts to issues of personal interest or significance

0D7D15899EFE419E8B40684D37DD6AA3.description: Discuss and explain various interpretations of the same oral, print or other media text

F6416CA7D8A04C34AC231FB32700C74C.description: Identify and discuss theme and point of view in oral, print and other media texts

54B4EE6F813C4A41B2F543C141CA780E.description: Analyze how the choices and motives of characters portrayed in oral, print and other media texts provide insight into those of self and others

D2D8AD3083974B7A95F66A46C66578D5.description: Consider peers' interpretations of oral, print and other media texts, referring to the texts for supporting or contradicting evidence

6394F8B175AE47B0BEFB3A08F62E64E6.description: Express the themes of oral, print or other media texts in different forms or genres

1F262B6230564FE9A0457A049F7BCC54.description: Compare and contrast own life situation with themes of oral, print and other media texts

AFAAC9C7E5E64C06B02A38E5A9F66B23.description: Consider historical context when developing own points of view or interpretations of oral, print and other media texts

C3D9BD36D5364AACB4ACCC6B16545D19.description: Identify and discuss how timeless themes are developed in a variety of oral, print and other media texts

CAE8C2C723DD49029113F15F2D712611.description: Experience oral, print and other media texts from a variety of cultural traditions and genres, such as essays, broadcast advertisements, novels, poetry, documentaries, films, electronic magazines and realistic fiction

2773A5FE9917488796EC7851BC810B9C.description: Use references: Use reference materials, including a writer's handbook, to verify correct usage, address uncertainties and solve problems that arise

BEF7A87220F64FF8BA77D13EEDBCCA30.description: Use phonics and structural analysis: Apply and explain effective procedures for identifying and comprehending words in context; adjust procedures according to the purpose for reading and the complexity of the texts

220CB9AF17394C578824F69C291C0319.description: Analyze and discuss how the structural features of informational materials, such as textbooks, bibliographies, databases, catalogues, web sites, commercials and newscasts, enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of communication

C89A9E7DD974456F8598024C0EC9A51B.description: Use knowledge of visual and textual cues and structural features when skimming and scanning various print and other media texts to locate relevant information effectively and efficiently

52485E746CDB4A828F48300B6AADB5F4.description: Preview complex texts as to their intent, content and structure, and use this information to set a purpose and select strategies for reading

59D681B1F37C4DE98B6B1E77F6AFDD2B.description: Select appropriate reading rate and strategies for comprehending texts less closely connected to prior knowledge and personal experiences

A181D297DFEF45B2A5C5DD1B2B3ABB05.description: Identify explicit and implicit ideas and information in texts; listen and respond to various interpretations of the same text

A8F55FC5A2A34AA3A4501BFA4B4C3897.description: Use previous reading experiences, personal experiences and prior knowledge as a basis for reflecting on and interpreting ideas encountered in texts

5220D38E07514EB8918235F71E695075.description: Discuss how interpretations of the same text might vary, according to the prior knowledge and experiences of various readers

7B72E50D681048A2971439E18C7598D9.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to comprehend and respond personally and critically to oral, print and other media texts.

29CB235CA974408C906F4F216BAA89B0.description: Extend understanding: Assess whether new information extends understanding by considering diverse opinions and exploring ambiguities

9335D1B197C7490CB844775169356D1D.description: Combine ideas: Examine and re-examine ideas, information and experiences from different points of view to find patterns and see relationships

98B8CBA00D624FFDB2DB5DFF0F9884B6.description: Consider the ideas of others: Integrate own perspectives and interpretations with new understandings developed through discussing and through experiencing a variety of oral, print and other media texts

B8D462FC9F8D4D1EA6D73E1E7BAEF63C.description: Set goals: Reflect on own growth in language learning and use, by considering progress over time and the attainment of personal goals

7431D25DBFBD4D90911EFDDA8542E5EF.description: Express preferences: Explain preferences for texts and genres by particular writers, artists, storytellers, and filmmakers

38511C16CEA8401A808EF30BF234B311.description: Experiment with language and forms: Develop and extend understanding by expressing and responding to ideas on the same topic, in a variety of forms of oral, print and other media texts

4F3082DF3F664A10A1FD5204787D17FD.description: Extend understanding by taking different points of view when rereading and reflecting on oral, print, and other media texts

C6469E2319B44092B711AF74536C4B67.description: Explore and explain how interactions with others and with oral, print and other media texts affect personal understandings

30E0D6362A9B4C92A75B4190D5EA4B4D.description: Talk with others and experience a variety of oral, print and other media texts to explore, develop and justify own opinions and points of view

1FD070D1C19E4002822B92137B10084A.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to explore thoughts, ideas, feelings and experiences.
